TopicTitle: Kerbin+ v1.1 - Planet Pack for PlanetFactory

Articles.Content:
Hi everyone!

My idea was to increase the excitement of the Kerbin Home System and now IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢am proud to present you the "Kerbin+" Planet Pack!

This Pack adds 5 new moons to Kerbin, a system that contains 3 moons (Loon, Min, Chi), a lonely Moon Ã¯Â¿Â¼ Ã¯Â¿Â¼ (Yukon) and a small asteroid/moon for Minmus (Deen).

I have already played 2 days with my Pack and have a lot of fun with it. Now you are able to have this fun too.

Suggestions, Ideas and other are welcome!

Screenshots:

Javascript is disabled. View full album

Installation:

1. Download the Planetfactory CE mod from Kragrathea and optional delete the three example systems in KSP\GameData\PlanetFactory\PluginData\PlanetFactory (Barry, Stella, Serious)

2. Drop the GameData folder into KSP main folder.

3. Select Kerbin+ AND the Sentar Expansion on load.

3. Have fun!

Download:

Download Kerbin+ v1.1f

Download Kerbin+ v1.0f

Changelog:

  • v1.1 - Complete rebelancing of the Pack(Orbits, Distance), Yukon have now atmosphere
  • v1.0f - Cleanup for Public

is this compatible with alternis kerbol?

Hmmmmm looking at some interesting planetary orbits there..... could you simulate Fire and Water being locked in orbit around each other? Not really sure how that would work..... one would obviously have to be the orbiting body in the other's SOI...

also would need the ability to have a Kerbal who looks like Prince.

This looks amazing, especially the textures and shapes. But the physics side of me is cringing pretty badly. The. 3 moon system and the dual set. Th really need to have more distance between them. Can you do this?

This looks amazing, especially the textures and shapes. But the physics side of me is cringing pretty badly. The. 3 moon system and the dual set. Th really need to have more distance between them. Can you do this?

Thanks, i have spend lot of time to optimize the Textures and shapes.

The physic yes..... It's pretty damn hard to configure the orbits (many bugs) but i will try what I can to make it even better.

@Starwaster Sry but this is too hard, i am a java not a c# developer

Hmmmmm looking at some interesting planetary orbits there..... could you simulate Fire and Water being locked in orbit around each other? Not really sure how that would work..... one would obviously have to be the orbiting body in the other's SOI...

also would need the ability to have a Kerbal who looks like Prince.

I think the cheat would be to make an incredibly small body in the center with effectively no SOI and make them both orbit that.

I think the cheat would be to make an incredibly small body in the center with effectively no SOI and make them both orbit that.

But wouldn't both moons have to be inside the SOI of the incredibly small body?

Hmmmmm looking at some interesting planetary orbits there..... could you simulate Fire and Water being locked in orbit around each other? Not really sure how that would work..... one would obviously have to be the orbiting body in the other's SOI...

It is possible to simulate a barycenter by creating a body that does not actually exist (or is perhaps necasserily tiny (microscopic) and then put two other bodies in orbits around it, so it appears that they are orbiting each other?

I think the cheat would be to make an incredibly small body in the center with effectively no SOI and make them both orbit that.

Oh right! That would be the vortex / tornado thing that lets people travel from one to the other....

Update 1.1 is out!

- Complete rebalancing of the Moon's orbits and distance, based on feedback.

- Yukon have now an atmosphere.

Have fun with the Update, feedback and other are always welcome!

I can't help but to find it would be quite a giggle (around here, at least) if the moon opposite of "Loon" were to be called "Toon" -- If you've ever been in Canada, you probably know what I mean -

cheesy pun, I know... but I can't help it - sometimes I don't make jokes any more than my jokes make me.... uh wait, did that even make sense?

anyhow - great initiative! I wish I wasn't so close to the infamous "32 bit dead-wall" for adding new stuff on top of the massive mod heaps I got piled up already... this might be worth a try though

keep up the good work!

cheers!

Edited January 31, 2014 by kiwiak

Forget to ask if they work with kethane and scansat.

Because of the way those two mods work, they are guaranteed to work with any and all planet packs.

Yes the Pack works without Sentar but Yukon is not visible. All other Moon's are still working.

And Moach thanks

I'll have to see if I can somehow strip down the Sentar config file and remove the texture and model assets (memory limit) while still preserving the dependency.

Thanks, i have spend lot of time to optimize the Textures and shapes.

The physic yes..... It's pretty damn hard to configure the orbits (many bugs) but i will try what I can to make it even better.

Well, you did a fantastic job on those textures AND the shapes - and it pays off in spades. My favorite is Loon because I recognize it as Jupiter's moon of Io. Something I forgot to ask since I haven't tried orbiting the moons yet. Do they have proper gravity based on size/mass?
